title: Almost 1,000 trapped on Tibetan side of Mount Everest by blizzard
byline: Rescue efforts were underway on Sunday to clear access to campsites on Tibet’s eastern slope of Mount Everest, where nearly 1,000 people have been trapped by a blizzard that has blocked roads, according to Chinese state media reports.

title: 7 including accomplice of ‘Midigama Ruwan’ arrested with 5.6kg Hash
byline: Sri Lanka Police said that seven suspects, including an accomplice of organized criminal ‘Midigama Ruwan’, have been arrested with 5.6 kilograms of Hashish.

title: Indonesia lifts TikTok licence suspension as app shares data
byline: Indonesia has lifted its suspension of TikTok’s local operating licence after the social media platform shared data requested by the government about recent protests, the ministry of communication and digital affairs said.

title: Gunmen kill two, injure 12 in shootout in crowd in Alabama’s Montgomery
byline: Rival gunmen started shooting at each other in a crowded downtown nightlife district in Alabama’s capital city Montgomery on Saturday night, killing two people and injuring 12 others, police said.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: TV Derana celebrates 20 years of excellence in Sri Lankan television
byline: Sri Lanka’s premier television channel, TV Derana, marks a significant milestone this month as it celebrates its 20th anniversary, continuing to uphold its brand credo of “Protecting indigenous values while protecting our future.”

title: Police obtain 7-day detention order on Backhoe Saman’s brother-in-law
byline: The Aluthkade Magistrate’s Court has granted permission to the Western Province North Crime Division to detain and interrogate the brother-in-law of notorious underworld criminal “Backhoe Saman” for seven days.

title: President hands over 1,000 new houses to low-income families
byline: The national ceremony to mark World Habitat Day was held today (05) at the Temple Tress under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Sailor from India missing from merchant ship off Sri Lankan coast – report
byline: A 22-year-old merchant navy cadet from India has gone missing off the coast of Sri Lanka while serving aboard an oil tanker, his family confirmed on Saturday.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Atmospheric conditions are favorable for thunderstorms in the evening. Therefore, general public is advised to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by strong winds and severe lightning during thundershowers, today (06), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump urges mediators to ‘move fast’ as key Gaza peace talks set to begin
byline: US President Donald Trump has urged everyone involved in efforts to end the Gaza war to “move fast” as mediators are set to meet in Egypt on Monday for indirect peace talks between Hamas and Israel.

title: Passenger arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle foreign cigarettes worth over Rs. 1.35 mln
byline: A Sri Lankan passenger has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) while attempting to smuggle a consignment of foreign-manufactured cigarettes worth Rs. 1.35 million into the country.

title: 17-year-old drowns in school swimming pool in Dikwella
byline: A 17-year-old schoolboy has reportedly drowned while attempting to retrieve a cricket ball that had fallen into the swimming pool at his school in Dikwella.

title: Hundreds of trekkers escape from blizzard-struck Everest in Tibet
byline: Hundreds of trekkers stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest in Tibet have been guided to safety by rescuers, Chinese state media reported on Sunday, as unusually heavy snow and rainfall pummelled the Himalayas.

title: CAA to take legal actions against 135 traders for selling rice at inflated prices
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has stated that legal proceedings have been initiated against 135 traders across the country for selling rice at inflated prices.

title: Two major associates of “Kalubowila Avishka” arrested in Piliyandala
byline: Two individuals have been arrested in the Bokundara, Piliyandala area with over two kilograms of the narcotic substance ‘Heroin’ by the Moratuwa Police Special Task Force (STF).

title: Gunman opens fire on Sydney street, injuring 20, one seriously
byline: A man is in custody after allegedly shooting up to a hundred bullets into a busy Sydney street, wounding 20 people, with police on Monday (Oct 6) ruling out links to terrorism or gang activity.

title: Four deaths reported in separate road accidents
byline: Four people have reportedly died in four separate road accidents in several parts of the island yesterday (05).

title: Eight patients killed in hospital fire in India’s Jaipur
byline: At least six critical patients were killed in a fire at the trauma centre of the state-run Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Hospital in Jaipur late Sunday, officials said.

title: President inaugurates Museum and International Research Institute at Somawathi Sacred Site
byline: The newly constructed two-storey building housing the Archaeological Museum and the International Archaeological Research Institute at the historic Somawathi sacred area in Polonnaruwa was declared open today (06) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Existing regulations hinder efforts to resolve the medicine shortage – Health Minister
byline: Certain existing laws and regulations have become obstacles in addressing the current medicine shortage, Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has said.

title: Weapons found hidden in abandoned house in Dematagoda
byline: The Crimes Investigation Division of the Bambalapitiya Police has discovered several weapons hidden in an abandoned house near the Kelani Valley railway line, on the Baseline Road in Dematagoda.

title: Three scientists get Nobel Prize in Medicine for discovery of peripheral immune tolerance
byline: Scientists Mary Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for "their discoveries concerning peripheral immune tolerance", the award-giving body said on Monday.

title: Thirty-two pigeons stolen from Dehiwala National Zoo, officials say
byline: A total of 32 pigeons have been stolen from the Dehiwala National Zoological Gardens, according to the administration of the zoo.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning in several provinces
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: First supermoon of 2025, the Harvest Moon, rises tonight
byline: The first supermoon of 2025 will appear in our skies tonight kicking off a series of lunar events.

title: Three killed, one injured in road accident in Gampola
byline: Three individuals traveling along the Gampola–Doluwa road have died while another person has sustained injuries in a road accident, police stated.

title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu resigns after less than a month
byline: France’s Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu has resigned, hours after his cabinet was unveiled.

title: French prosecutors probe Apple’s Siri following complaint
byline: French prosecutors said on Monday they are investigating tech giant Apple’s voice assistant Siri after receiving a complaint from a tech researcher accusing the company of illicit data collection.

title: Ex-President Mahinda should face strict action: Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa should face strict action, says former Commander of the Sri Lanka Army Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka.

title: One dead, two hospitalised due to drowning near Blue Beach Island
byline: Three individuals have been swept away due strong currents while bathing in seas near the Blue Beach Island in Dikwella, police stated.

title: 32 OICs transferred with immediate effect
byline: A total of 32 Officers-in-Charge (OICs) have been transferred and appointed to new positions with the approval of the National Police Commission.

title: Israel deports 171 Gaza flotilla activists, including Greta Thunberg
byline: Israel said on Monday that an additional 171 activists from the Gaza aid flotilla, including climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, were deported on Monday to Greece and Slovakia.

title: 36-year-old woman arrested following tragic Gampola accident
byline: A tragic accident was reported earlier today (06) in Doluwa, Gampola, where three women lost their lives after being hit by a car.

title: Human Rights Council adopts resolution on Sri Lanka
byline: The resolution A/HRC/60/L.1/Rev.1 on promoting reconciliation, accountability and human rights in Sri Lanka has been adopted at the United Nations Human Rights Council in Genève.

title: Tusker ‘Manika’ of Bellanwila Temple passes away
byline: ‘Manika,’ a majestic tusker lived at the Bellanwila Temple and was around 76 years old, passed away this afternoon (October 6).

title: English author Jilly Cooper dies at age 88
byline: English author Dame Jilly Cooper has died at age 88, her family has announced.

title: PM Harini to attend NDTV World Summit
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya is scheduled to attend the NDTV World Summit 2025 along with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Surging numbers of children using e-cigarettes: WHO
byline: More than 100 million people, including at least 15 million children, use e-cigarettes, fuelling a new wave of nicotine addiction, the World Health Organization (WHO) is warning.

title: Experts highlight rise in HIV cases among 15 to 29 age group
byline: Health authorities in Sri Lanka have warned of an increasing trend of HIV infections among individuals aged between 15 and 29.

title: Gaza ceasefire talks begin in Egypt
byline: Delegations from Israel and Hamas began indirect negotiations in Egypt on Monday that the U.S. hopes will bring a halt to the war in Gaza, facing contentious issues such as demands that Israel pull out of the enclave and Hamas to disarm.
